website_summaries.verdict: Tough nut cracker looks great and works well. All metal design will stand up to tough treatment.
pros: Works with all kinds of nuts
Nut cracker is mounted on a hardwood base
Reasonable price point for a well-made device
Small sized – can be stored easily in a drawer
cons: Struggles to crack some smaller nuts
Doesn't always split nuts in halves

customer_reviews.title: Wow an wow this is best nut cracker I’ve ever got I had so many ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow an wow this is best nut cracker I’ve ever got I had so many pecans this year an it came through for me I would tell any body to get this cracker
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on a review of the product. Because of this review saying it would work for pistachio's, I went ahead and decided to give it a try. When I received it I saw that it was adjustable, so I adjusted it to fit the pistachio's I had been saving to try out this Nut Cracker. It worked great. The first one I tried blew apart in a million pieces. I readjusted the anvils and the next one cracked perfectly. Might sound silly to spend money on pistachio's, but I love these nuts and hate it when I have some that are not open. Would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ldsmurf

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my cousin and he said it is works quite well, however he wishes the base was larger so he could anchor it to his work table; he did say there seems to be room on the wood plate for him to be able to drill holes screws. He is using this for walnuts and said it works well and is saving his fingers being hit from the hammer he had been using, additionally he mentioned the shells don't shatter quite so much. He went on to say that he could crack in 25-30 minutes what would take him 40 minutes with the hammer. Have no idea of the durability of the product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: adjustable to nut size
customer_reviews.text: cracks walnuts better than I expected; and the 4 tools that were included were very useful. I would buy again and recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: Laura K

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing out there (to my knowledge) that can give you the nut full and nice put of the shell. So, knowing this, this cracker is pretty good! You have to assess the pressure and the angle best to work with and then you can get some decent pieces out, without even having to use the picks. We are pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Camelia Wierzba

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy duty as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find something that could take the rigors of cracking a hickory nut. Since pecan is in the same genus (carya) as the other hickories I thought I'd give this a shot. Total fail. The handle bent over and the nut just laughed. Back to a big rock for me for hickory cracking. You might do ok on something a little less strong like a walnut though. I'd take off more points except it wasn't billed as an "any hickory", just "pecan" (still a hickory).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Carol

customer_reviews.title: He and all the grandkids enjoy using the nut cracker and making a mess everywhere ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my dad. He and all the grandkids enjoy using the nut cracker and making a mess everywhere for grandma.
customer_reviews.author: kmg

customer_reviews.title: Great device! It is well built and the cam-over ...
customer_reviews.text: Great device! It is well built and the cam-over leverage makes cracking nuts easy. It cracks the nut lengthwise so the pieces are larger and easier to get to. I'd buy again and I'll give them as gifts. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: jbtusa

customer_reviews.title: works on Brazil nuts
customer_reviews.text: i like how it is adjustable so you can do different size nuts. it has a good length handle to give leverage to crack nuts. heavy duty looks like it will last a long time. only thing needed is, i think, i will attach it to something like a larger piece of board to make it a one handed operation; so i can hold the nut while getting the lever into "starting" position..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nut cracker!!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the mechanism adjusts for different size nuts. It cracks pecans with out any trouble. Be careful with the lever area maybe brace other hand around bottom of nut cracker to prevent sliding and to prevent she'll from flying across room. Also adjust your strength while pulling lever down it doesn't take much or your nut will be pulverized.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Not crazy about this. When it worked, it smashed the nuts into smithereens. After a dozen or so uses, it came unscrewed from the wooden base and the holes in the wood were stripped so we just chucked it. Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: So easy and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have a walnut tree and we are getting a lot of nuts every year. If I use hand nutcracker, it is much more work and even I had blister on my palm. This nutcracker is so easy and very fast to crack nuts. It makes a mess with nuts shells so when I use it I cover it with a potholder with my left hand and press the handle.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Open Macadamia Nuts Very Well
customer_reviews.text: One of the pictures seemed to show them opening a "mac nut" so I decided to give it a try because the lever arm is of the type needed to crack the very hard shell. Also the design seemed to suggest you can control the pressure against the nut so that it could be cracked open without damaging the meat. The pressure required to crack the shell is so high, that when the shell breaks, it smashes into the meat. This could be corrected by a longer lever but the relatively small size of the unit and the base makes it unsuitable to open macadamia nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to shell pecans. It takes some trial and error to "get the hang" of it. I did two modifications that helped a lot: I remounted the device on a larger piece of wood to make it more stable. I also extended the handle (used the "bell" end of a piece of 1/2" PVC conduit) for more leverage, making it much easier to use. The picks are pretty much useless, but a paring knife works quite well as a picker. I am able to extract the pecan halves intact about 70% of the time. I am happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: SMLman

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke after explosively opening 6 Mac nuts... cheap metal. Hand nut cracker and hammer are more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: peaceful lady

customer_reviews.title: Great design and price -- but not durable!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this reasonably priced nut cracker for cracking macadamia nuts (a neighbor grows them) for close to two years but the materials are not adequate for its purpose (the lever arm snapped near the hinge). Similar designs (with adequate materials) cost 10x more so I guess it's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: VERY cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: This product is VERY cheaply made - would not even crack a hickory nut! And the window closed one month after purchase on being able to return product. Nuts weren't ready to start being cracked. HORRIBLE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Tammi F.

customer_reviews.title: Quality to last, EASY to use!
customer_reviews.text: From small local pecans to the garden varieties & walnuts, this is quality that will last! We have a pecan orchard and an historic inn so mounted this to small bar stools so our guests can crack away! Attached them to the bar stools so they don’t “accidentally” become sovereign's!
customer_reviews.author: REG

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough for macadamia nuts.
customer_reviews.text: The wooden handle on the metal lever split down the length, in 2 pieces. The remaining underlying metal lever is uncomfortable in the hand making it difficult/painful to use. Also, the metal size adjustable screw gets stuck if turned to the smallest-nut size. I would not recommend this to anyone. Spend a little extra money, and buy a vice instead. "Buy 1 nice, or buy cheap twice."
customer_reviews.author: maestroooh

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Follow Up Review: Completely fell apart, see photo. Original Review 2 Stars: About half of my walnuts were smaller than the adjusted size. When I try to adjust the threaded bolt (with a pliers) it just shaves the cheap metal and won't turn. Disappointed and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Old Lady

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Use
customer_reviews.text: Great for cracking the shells of Pecans without harming the meat inside. Easy to maintain the wholeness of the nut. Advise to the user... occasionally ensure the handle is tight in the housing. Has a tendency to loosen, which could cause the threads to strip. Otherwise, this product makes it much easier to process fresh pecans from my 2 trees for the delicious deserts I make for Thanksgiving and Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: SUDS

customer_reviews.title: well engineered pecan cracker
customer_reviews.text: This nut cracker looks and feels like it should give many years of service. It arrived in excellent condition and when promised. Very happy. Richard
customer_reviews.author: richard beal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pecan halves and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son, this was his first year as a home owner and he was inundated by pecans. This was a welcome gift right before the holidays. We all enjoyed the pecan pies at Thanksgiving and Christmas with perfect pecan halves. I have one myself and have given several as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Pattison

customer_reviews.title: Messy and not stable
customer_reviews.text: Cracks the nuts but is so light weight that it doesn’t stay on the table well and it shoots pieces everywhere. I suggest using it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Isis33

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one for me and one for my daughter we both love them we were struggling trying to crack our pecan this tool works like a charm! A lot quicker than most! Does not break them all to pieces ! Adjustable to the size of your nuts! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Should Be Larger
customer_reviews.text: While the cracker works OK, it would be much better if the device was larger and had a longer handle providing greater leverage. I will probably modify mine to mount it on a larger base and build a longer handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joy M.

customer_reviews.title: nut cracker
customer_reviews.text: I bought the nutcracker to shell macadamia nuts but it does not work on them. There is no way to regulate the cracking pressure and it is very difficult to use on macadamia nuts LGM
customer_reviews.author: Ms. LGM

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely like it; could be a little more heavy duty. Serves its purpose without the risk of pinching fingers like pliers would. My 4 year old uses it. Very easy to adjust based on size of pecan you're cracking. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: It's shiny and durable, that's about all of the good points.
customer_reviews.text: I only used this product on pecans, a nut of widely varying size. While the nutcracker is highly adjustable, the drawback is unless you presort the nuts by size, too much time is lost. If you try to decrease crushing pressure instead of changing the adjustment for nut size you might get lucky sometimes, but more than likely the pecan will explode and you will have more than enough little pecan pieces for your brownies. I formerly used a pliers-like capping tool for pecans, lost those. I'll order another one today.
customer_reviews.author: waldo2909

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. Arthritic hands make standard type difficult. This is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for gifting.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Most of the time I can get perfect half pieces. It would make a good gift along with a bag of fresh Georgia pecans. It’s smaller than I thought but sturdy and holding up with harder nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great but cracker
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy and worked well opening pecans. I haven't tried any other nuts. I would give this 5 stars. But it states that this comes with 4 picks. Lies! It comes with 2.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: Easy tp adjust
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about it,small,strong easy to use and adjust for different size pecans.. it is better for me to stand up and use it. It gives you better leverage but you can use it while sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron Campbell

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase 👌🏾
customer_reviews.text: My wife’s parents has an older model and I bought this one to use at home. Very study, does the job and easy to use! In addition the multiple stainless steel pickers that comes with it are very handy in picking out prices of nuts and I also use them to pick out crab meat.
customer_reviews.author: JTGE

customer_reviews.title: To much work
customer_reviews.text: It is not the best version. It smashed my pecans until I found the exact placement for the screw end and screw end moves constantly. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: A_Casual_Collector

customer_reviews.title: I bought this product in the hope of cracking Macademia ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in the hope of cracking Macademia nuts; unfortunately it was inappropriate for this use, not heavy enough Let me know if you have a much heavier product as a nutcracker
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: It is for My wife, so I haven't used it My self. But it is very sturdy and well made. And it was amazing how fast it got here.
customer_reviews.author: kevin hamilton

customer_reviews.title: not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for black walnuts. I ended up using a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Bent with first use
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps other nuts will work fine.... but black walnuts are too tough for this little machine. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: pink fluffy slipper world

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! Makes cracking pecans easy. Made well, seems durable. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Loves 2 Cook

customer_reviews.title: It's cracked about 50 lbs of pecans this season
customer_reviews.text: If you've got alot of nuts to bust it comes in handy. Works better attached to counter or larger base. Watch your knuckles! It's pretty easy to bust them too. Would rate higher if lever was long enough to avoid this mishap. But you'll learn PDQ.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use and it moves when trying to crack nuts. It was good for cracking different size nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Hariett Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Does not stand up to Macadamia Nuts
customer_reviews.text: If you have macadamia nuts to crack - don’t buy this. Fell apart within a week of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality!!
customer_reviews.text: This nutcracker is of very low quality. I purchased it for my 90 year old father in law. He had a very old one that looked similar but it finally broke. I purchased this one thinking it would last another 50 years or more. However it broke the second week he used it. We welded his old one and it works fine. This new unit cannot even be welded, because it is made of some low quality alloy.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Consumer

customer_reviews.title: what a GREAT pecan cracker
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. Mounted it to a longer board, and I am a cracking machine. I get full pecans out lots of times, and complete halves almost all of the time. A must have if you have pecans to crack. Beats using a channel lock plier for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana J

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for macadamia nuts.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for macadamia nuts. The handle and size adjuster bent after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as heavy and sturdy as my old pecan nut cracker but gets the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Not as heavy and sturdy as my old pecan nut cracker but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: BGA

customer_reviews.title: Not too easy
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as it sounds. Especially for an older person with arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Glidewell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdily made. Convenient to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable screw allows for different sizes of the nuts. Convenient to use
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne M. Masden

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!!
customer_reviews.text: Small, but just right for “personal” pecan-cracking jobs. Strong and adjustable to length of pecan. Takes some arm strength to lever down. I am very satisfied with it and the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: C. O. Park

customer_reviews.title: Best done at patio table or outside as bits and pieces of the shell do go all over
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfectly functional and works surprising well. Disappointed that time wasn’t taken to square the metal frame of nut cracker to the wooden block. This doesn’t affect operation of tool just doesn’t leave a good first impression of product coming from brand. Comes with little metal picks to extract the nuts tool over all is great for money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bone

customer_reviews.title: Works but...
customer_reviews.text: Not the highest of quality. The rivets and construction look sub par. The product does work but i question how long it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Cracker arrived in perfect shape
customer_reviews.text: The four picks promised in the head line and shown in picture are missing
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Cracks any kind of nuts!!
customer_reviews.text: We got it on time and works as described. I recommend this product for pecans and other hard shell nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 79 year old mother. She likes picking up the pecans from her trees, but needed help getting them cracked. She loved it. It’s easy enough for her to handle and now says she’ll have plenty pecans for Christmas baking.
customer_reviews.author: L Eben

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, just don't press too hard!
customer_reviews.text: convenient, but don't press too hard otherwise you will break into many pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cracker
customer_reviews.text: This gizmo is going to save me time. I have a huge bag of tiny pecans that would take forever to crack but this device is going to make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hickory Nuts
customer_reviews.text: It was a good year for hickory nuts. However, those things are nearly impossible to crack open. After trying multiple ways to crack, we purchased this nutcracker, which also comes with two picks to get the meat out of the shell. It works very well.... cracks the shell without crushing the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B.

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two!  Both Work Nicely
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. One for me -- one for a gift. Both work nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Iheartmanatees

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to crack macadamia nuts and it does not work. I've pinched my hand several times trying to get it to crack the nuts. When it does finally crack one, it actually crushes it. I tried to return it but to my dismay I learned that you have to return items within 30 days. I was too late because of being distracted by the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model and wore it out. The threads on the handle wore off so I can’t keep it intact. Yours is made if a lighter material but works wonderfully. I get most pecans out of their shells in beautiful halves.
customer_reviews.author: Tootsie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with a variety of sizes and types of pecans
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use and whole halves. A bit messy, but used newspapers under cracker to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: RBonem

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: it’s a lite duty cracker should work for years. Cracks both pecans and English walnut, adjust for different size nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Buffalo Tom

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy
customer_reviews.text: This is the best water bottle I have found. I love that my ice doesn't melt away in a few hours. I actually have a half of bottle of ice still in it the next day. The only problem I had is it is too big for the drink holders in the car. Best deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen D

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great brings back memories of when I was a kid and me granddad had one.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Works great to crack pecans
customer_reviews.text: Works, helps getting the job done but is fatiguing when you have lots of nuts to crack.
customer_reviews.author: Dudi

customer_reviews.title: Super nut smasher
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought for my wife years ago. Great way to knock out a bunch of pecans. Just needs to be used at a table, otherwise hard to get leverage. Also kinda messy but gets the job done, easy on the hands.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sampert

customer_reviews.title: Works decent with other buts but macadamia. My macadamia ...
customer_reviews.text: Works decent with other buts but macadamia. My macadamia trees produced so many nuts this year but this doesn’t work for them :(
customer_reviews.author: Catalin Petcu

customer_reviews.title: Nutcracker
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product it is good for cracking nuts
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for cracking walnuts. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Peters

customer_reviews.title: Product works as designed
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. Need a little more room on the wood base for stabilization when cracking really hard shells.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these the first one works extremely well the second doenst work very well the handel is very stiff to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Can’t find this in stores anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a friend of mine and had it shipped to them. They really enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Willis

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it need to do - works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: This nut cracker is sturdy and easy to use. The one end is reversible, for larger or smaller nuts. The picks are really handy for nutmeat pieces that do get stuck in the shells, sometimes. We love our nut cracker and brag about how great it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: Item too small
customer_reviews.text: . Was NOT able to crack walnuts; metal base of item bend under pressure when trying to crack walnuts. Items was able to crack pecans, but had to apply a lot of force. Difficult to create enough force.
customer_reviews.author: MJR

customer_reviews.title: Special cracker for pecans.
customer_reviews.text: What a clever little tool. Usual nutcrackers do not work well with pecans as it cracks the meat within. This one cracks the pecan with pressure on both ends leaving the meat inside intact. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph L. Hetzel

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: the nut cracker is just as described but I have not had a chance to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Atlas

customer_reviews.title: Works for pistachios too.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this but cracker for pistachios that hadn't opened fully. It can be adjusted small enough for them.
customer_reviews.author: Iris C.

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact cracker - one at a time. Adjustable for different size nute. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JimB

customer_reviews.title: This is a fast way to crack pecans!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. It's fast and efficient. Almost all of them come out with two perfect halves!
customer_reviews.author: Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great nut cracker
customer_reviews.text: Best nut cracker I've ever used. Solid and sturdy construction. Great for cracking pecans. I definitely recommend this and will gift to people.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Works great, why pay more for the same thing plus they give you 4 metal picks. Well made and I have already cracked 28 gallons of pecans with it.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Butts

customer_reviews.title: The use of this product was easy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for the large amounts of pecans this year in the yard. The nut cracker is easy to handle and works perfect for me. I would recommend this nut cracker to anyone for native pecans or walnuts.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cane

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Fancy duehicky that doesn't do what you want it to do. The old fashioned nut crackers work just as good- maybe even better.
customer_reviews.author: Needle Nose

customer_reviews.title: Nut cracker cracks nuts
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Easy screw adjustment to size the different nuts. I crack mostly filberts, but anticipate walnuts and cashews.
customer_reviews.author: clyde ranney

customer_reviews.title: I tried to use this cracker on walnuts, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this cracker on walnuts, but no way. I had to crack them using a vise first.
customer_reviews.author: "barbarasz"

customer_reviews.title: Great tools
customer_reviews.text: They work great for what we needed! Easy to use and does the job!
customer_reviews.author: James E. Furber

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great. We did attach it to a bigger piece of wood to make it more stable. Very pleased with how it cracks our pecans.
customer_reviews.author: Arlianne Martin

customer_reviews.title: Can’t crack macadamia nuts!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this cracker does not crack macadamia nuts. Many potential buyers have asked and I did purchase to see due to the description saying “etc.” on nuts. It is not strong enough to crack Mac nuts. Returned for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda C. Pfafflin

customer_reviews.title: Durable and cracks great.
customer_reviews.text: Our Walnut savior! We are so happy with this. We harvest walnuts for personal use and we use this everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Wineandarose

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely versatile, but could use a larger base and maybe a cover for when nuts are cracked. It definitely gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Husband said it work fine
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband and he said it worked fine
customer_reviews.author: Linda Owenby

customer_reviews.title: The Nut Cracker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and makes shelling nuts fun and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey K Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great for pecans quick and easy bought another for a friend
customer_reviews.author: cheryl gamble

customer_reviews.title: Shelling pecans
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but I’m too lazy to use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I'm honestly thinking about ordering another since I have a 5 gallon bucket of pecans to crack that someone gave me. I sure won't let these pecans go to waste!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not for black walnuts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to crack black walnuts and in that.... It failed miserably. It seemed sturdy enough for some smaller nuts and nuts with shells not as hard at black walnuts.
customer_reviews.author: Alayna Hegwood

customer_reviews.title: Safe for our grandchildren to use
customer_reviews.text: All the grandkids like to use this cracker, and the design makes it safe from pinched fingers. It builds their muscles, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Marks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in price but cheap in construction
customer_reviews.text: It worked alright up until it broke. It's definitely not made to crack hard nuts. I cracked about 30 hickory nuts with it before the rivets sheared off and the lever cracked. I'll be buying something more sturdy. For the price I can't complain too much though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth your money. It is super easy to use. It's a quality product that will last.

product_meta.title: Hiware Good Heavy Duty Pecan Nut Cracker Tool with 4 Picks, Wood Base & Handle
